text: UVA students, get on this! Great opportunity:
author: pastpunditry

text: Oh man, the historian in me wants you to write a book, but I’ll take a long-form piece to tide me over. (Really: can’t wait to read more on this.)
author: pastpunditry

text: You should! It’s implicit in much of your writing, but the way you framed it here really grabbed my attention.
author: pastpunditry

text: On this week’s Gabfest, ⁦@jbouie⁩ offers up the intriguing (and persuasive) argument that the greatest and most consistent threat to democracy over the past 150 years has been white supremacy (Civil War, Jim Crow, Nazi Germany).
author: pastpunditry

text: Yeah, things went off the rails petty quickly with that one.
author: pastpunditry

text:
Let’s see, he’s praised Richard Spencer and has tweeted “1488” and “white genocide” nonsense.  I’m pretty comfortable with my description.

(Posobiec is welcome to try to rebrand himself; no one is obliged to play along.)
author: pastpunditry

text: The president is retweeting alt-right racist trolls again, in case you were wondering how this weekend’s twitter-binge was going.
author: pastpunditry

text: I've been thinking about this incident a lot in recent days. Fox News & conservative media were ginning up anti-Muslim frenzies well before Trump's rise. In fact, it helps explain some of his popularity in 2016: a Muslim ban was the logical next step for right-wing audiences.
author: pastpunditry

text: Such a great event — so impressed by student-led efforts to ensure they receive training in public engagement as part of their graduate education.
author: pastpunditry
